intro: Linaria smithii, commonly known as Smith's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Linaria smithii is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
